scenario_text.value:
Oh, Takuma, it’s you! You’re not lost again,
are you?

Sorry, just kidding. Listen, can I ask you
about something?
Sure, go ahead. What’s on your mind?

Well, maybe it’s not the sort of thing
I should be asking you about, but...

...do you really think we’ll all end up going
back home?
(So, Saki’s worried about that too.)
(What should I say to her?)
What should I say to Saki?
You think we won’t?
This place is scary.
It’ll all work out.

Are you saying you think we won’t? That we’ll
never make it back?

No, it’s not really a question of my doubting
whether we’ll make it or not.

But sometimes, I find myself wondering if
we’ll even have a choice.

(Sounds like Saki has something on her
mind...)

I can see where you’re coming from. This
world is a terrifying place.
But, don’t you just feel so alive here?

Each time we triumph over a life-or-death
situation, it’s just this huge rush...

It’s like a thrill I can feel running down my
spine...

(So...is Saki saying she doesn’t want to go
back?)

Don’t worry, I’m sure this is all going to
work out.

What, are you trying to kid yourself? Haha,
that’s funny.
I mean, not that I’m any different...

(I think Saki was saying that last part more
to herself than to me.)
(She seemed kind of upset when she said it.)
Well, anyway, we should be getting back.

The others will start worrying before too
much longer. Come on, Takuma.
Yeah, right...

Thanks for the chat. I’m feeling a bit better
n—*cough!*

*cough* *cough* Sor—*cough* *cough*
*cough*...!

Hey, are you okay? Did you catch a cold or
something?

Oh, no! I’m fine! I just had something stuck
in my throat.

(I’m...not so sure about that. I hope she’s
okay.)
